channel.description: Recent content in dotJAR Development Blog on dotJAR - Development Blog

item.title: Progress and Presentation
item.description:
Progress, Report and Presentaiton

Meeting Summary

In this meeting multiple updates were given and reported, as well as continuing to work in the progress report 1 and its presentaiton.

  1. All the tasks related to the front-end were completed, including wireframes, a site map, and the componenets to be used. Development of the HTML and CSS implenention was about to start.
  2. The tasks related to the database were completed, a schema of the tables and the Entety Relation Diagram were completed.
  3. The front end was reported to be behind. This was hugely due to technical debt, in other words, the amount of time required to develop expertise in this area was longer than expected, and thus the design for route and controllers was behind.

Other than this, the members continued to work on the progress report and the presentation.

item.title: Client Meeting
item.description:
Client Meeting


Meeting Summary

Every thursday the team members have a meeting with the clients regarding updates and status, particularly important information was discusssed in this meeting:

  1. The wireframes were shown to the client
  2. The client provided information on the tools, in this case specifically kits and libraries, used for the integration of the authentication used in UPRM.

Meeting Schedule

  • Date: [03/07/2025]
  • Time: 10:30am - 12pm
  • Location: In Person, CTI office

Attendees

  • Angel Aquino
  • Jael Gonzalez
  • Ramon Rosario
  • Martin Menendex
  • Andres Rosado

Agenda & Discussion

  • The addition of letter generation -> It was determined the platform will include a system to automatically generate (using a template) the approval cards for associations.
  • Two new dependices -> It was determined that the laravel\breeze kit will be used for scaffol and socialiteprovider\saml2 will be used for SAML2 integration.

Next Meeting

Date: 03/09/2025

item.title: Latest Meetings
item.description:
Latest Meetings


Since the team does daily meetings, it’s hard to keep track to the minute detail, however the following has happened:

  1. Had a meeting with the client were the topic of the SRS was talked about, as well as other topics.
  2. The SRS document was submitted by the group.

From now on, we will follow the recommended template. However, the formatting is bound to change eventually for a cleaner look.

item.title: Reworking Meetings
item.description:
Reworking Meetings Format

Last week the team finish and submitted the proposal report.

As per requirement from the course, a new structure for meetings will be implemented. The formating is the following:

Meeting Summary
Date: [MM/DD/YYYY]
Time: [Start - End]
Location: [Physical/Virtual]

Attendees
[Name 1], [Name 2], [Name 3], etc.
Agenda & Discussion
[Agenda Item 1] – [Key points, decisions, action items]
[Agenda Item 2] – [Key points, decisions, action items]
[Agenda Item 3] – [Key points, decisions, action items]
Action Items
Task	Owner	Deadline
[Task 1]	[Person 1]	[MM/DD/YYYY]
[Task 2]	[Person 2]	[MM/DD/YYYY]
Next Meeting
Date/Time: [MM/DD/YYYY, HH:MM]

Given that the team has daily meetings, the updates of the blog will be uploaded daily.

item.title: Working the Proposal
item.description:
Working on the Proposal

There’s not much update on the project itself. The team remain workings on the proposal report.

Other than this the team has been looking into tools for designing Gantt charts since OpenLibre seems old and clunky.

Also, the team has been learning about Laravel through Laracast, a website that goes from learning the most basic PHP to complex topics and finally to the Laravel framework.

That’s all for now,

item.title: Finished Setup
item.description:
The Setup


After much work, the blog has finally been setup and hosted on GitHub Pages.

Here’s a brief update on the project’s progress so far:

  • Multiple meetings have been held with the clients.
  • An oral proposal presentation was delivered to the class.

Moving forward, regular updates will be provided on important milestones and meetings.

- dotJAR team 🫙

item.title: The Beginning
item.description:
Here we go!

Initial post for dotJAR development blog.

In this blog progress of the project will be continously posted.

item.title: About Us
item.description:
Meet the Members

The dotJAR team is made up of three computer engineering students:

Jael Gonzalez (Blog Maintainer)

Group’s project manager. Front-end developer, working on the pages and all the deisgn of the platforms.  

Angel Aquino

Back-end developer, focusing on working with how to set-up the website endspoints, managing the requests, and setting up the API to get and send the data.  

Ramon Rosario

Back-end developer, focusing on working with how the database schema is set up, and all the database queries to fetch and send data (related to the API).
